translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Vibhīṣaṇa
The Elder Vedikāraka’s Birth Story
“When the Fortunate One Padumuttara
Was the Bodhi tree’s most excellent son,
Having made a well-made railing,
I delighted in my own mind.
From the sky there rained down

analyzed: katāni a katāni ca  antalikkhā pavassanti
translated: both finished and unfinished goods,
This was the fruit of the railing.
In a battle where the two armies clashed,
while charging in fearsome way,
I did not see any fear or terror,
This was the fruit of the railing.
In accordance with my thought,
a beautiful house was built,
With very expensive beds,
This was the fruit of the railing.
For a hundred thousand years,
I made a railing,
I do not know of any bad destination,
This was the fruit of the railing.
My defilements were burnt up,
I live without defilements.
It was good for me to come,
I have done what the Buddha said.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Buddha said.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā vedikārako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā vedikārakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus has the venerable Elder Vedikāraka recited these verses.
The Story of the Elder Vedikāraka is finished.
